title: Historical Stock Price Performance of Trade Desk Inc During Significant Market Events

content.text: During the market crash of 2008, Trade Desk Inc (TTD) was not yet a publicly traded company. It was founded in 2009, after the crash had occurred. Therefore, there is no data available for TTD during this specific market event.

The COVID-19 pandemic, which began in early 2020, had a significant impact on global markets. In the case of Trade Desk Inc, its stock initially experienced a sharp decline as uncertainty and fear spread throughout the market. From February 19 to March 18, 2020, TTD stock dropped by approximately 62%. However, as the market started to recover and adapt to the pandemic, Trade Desk Inc stock gradually rebounded and even reached new all-time highs later in the year.

content.section: Trade tensions between the US and China
content.text: Trade tensions between the United States and China have been ongoing for several years, causing fluctuations in the stock market. While these tensions indirectly impact Trade Desk Inc, the company's stock performance has not been explicitly tied to this geopolitical issue. Therefore, there are no specific crashes or rallies directly related to trade tensions between the US and China.

The dot-com bubble was a significant market event that occurred in the late 1990s and early 2000s. As Trade Desk Inc was founded in 2009, it did not exist during this bubble. Hence, there is no data available for TTD during the dot-com bubble.
During the global financial crisis of 2008, Trade Desk Inc was not yet a publicly traded company. Therefore, there is no data available for TTD during this specific market event.

Current market volatility, influenced by various factors like economic uncertainty, geopolitical tensions, and market speculation, impacts the stock price of Trade Desk Inc along with the overall market. It is essential to analyze real-time data and market conditions to evaluate the stock's performance during ongoing market events.

news.headline: The Trade Desk stock soars on Q2 earnings beat, revenue growth
news.summary: Shares of The Trade Desk (TTD) are soaring after the company beat second quarter estimates on both the top and bottom lines. The ad tech company reported revenue grew 26% year-over-year in the second quarter. Market Domination Hosts Josh Lipton and Madison Mills dig into the earnings report and how its partnerships have contributed to its overall growth. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Market Domination. This post was written by Melanie Riehl

news.headline: Why The Trade Desk (TTD) Stock Is Up Today
news.summary: Shares of advertising software maker The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) jumped 9.2% in the morning session after the company reported second-quarter earnings results. The Trade Desk improved its gross margin this quarter. Notably, sales grew 26% year on year, driven by solid performance across its key operating segments, including connected TV, retail media, and identity. Moving on, next quarter's revenue guidance came in higher than Wall Street's estimates. Overall, this was a sloid quarter for TTD.

news.headline: The Trade Desk: Q2 Earnings Snapshot
news.summary: TTD) on Thursday reported second-quarter net income of $85 million. On a per-share basis, the Ventura, California-based company said it had net income of 17 cents. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense, were 39 cents per share.

news.headline: The Trade Desk's (NASDAQ:TTD) Q2 Sales Beat Estimates, Stock Soars
news.summary: Advertising software maker The Trade Desk (NASDAQ:TTD) reported results ahead of analysts' expectations in Q2 CY2024, with revenue up 25.9% year on year to $584.6 million. Guidance for next quarter's revenue was also optimistic at $618 million at the midpoint, 2.1% above analysts' estimates. It made a non-GAAP profit of $0.39 per share, improving from its profit of $0.07 per share in the same quarter last year.
